Cheers Jim, I though it was probably late Akasaka, whilst the theme
was si=
mular in the Bush=FB work, the type of work is as you say, very

Rich



> Rich,
> The appearance of th=
e metal, the shape of the rim and your
description of the lamination bones =
in the edge all point to Akasaka.
 The very small size and thin plate point=
 toward later work.  It's
later than Ron's Tadashige.  Bushu Ito people did=
 use that design, but
the metal and rim are different.  The Mosle/Izzard It=
o example is in
shakudo and the carving is of course very different despite=
